column3: >yeah, this looks like something I made. will have to listen to this at some point.
>adding a @logs virtual group to this zet, because it makes exporting an easier problem to solve.
>this way, I don't have to do tree traversal and shit like that. just make sure messages are tied to this group.

>there's no way to check if a entry belongs to exactly *one* of the core groups being exported. so it's very possible to create duplicate entries by mistake. we will cross that bridge when we get there. #updates
>success! first wavetable loaded from a crate into an instance of =oscf= via =monolith=. woo!
>lots of duplicates removed. I have to be more careful about which groups I link messages too!
>zet message generation for weewiki is up and running now. testing out !logs and !akwf.
>added some shell scripts in a folder called 'u'. should save a few keystrokes this way.
>today, I'm implementing a shuffle feature in the zet that allows me to randomly pick files given a pattern. the hope is to better automate guess-and-check.
>some fruitful results using phase distortion today on an !akwf waveform. It'll be interesting to see what sort of timbral variety that technique will bring.
>applying a @labels group. will make up categories as I go.
>some more utilties managing labels and groups. I now can look up an entry and get the list of groups and labels they are a part of.
>imported some drum samples I cut from unfa beatboxing.
>the bc label is meant to be for things related to my breathing cards etude series.
